website_summaries.verdict: Includes 8 complete prep tests. Brand has had great success with SAT prep.
pros: Extremely detailed explanations of answers on the prep tests, which will help you understand why you missed a question
Advice on ways to score higher
Plenty of sample tests to help you assess your areas of strength and weakness
cons: Math section in this book doesn't offer the kind of detail some students require

customer_reviews.title: Great study guide
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter to used to help study for her SAT’s. It has a lot of useful information. Practice tests with answers. Great study tool. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Caldwell0623

customer_reviews.title: Watch Your Toes
customer_reviews.text: This has to be one of these biggest books I have ever seen. So, watch your toes if you knock it off the table. If you need to smash something flat, this is the book to use. As far as a good study guide for the SAT, this seems to be a good book to use. There are practice tests and it provides great information to help one prepare for the SAT. We will see as my daughter takes the SAT on how well it helps her.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Wittman

customer_reviews.title: Great study guide
customer_reviews.text: This is great study guide book to prepare for exam. Lots of questions to solve and practice so you can be ready for the exam. Have multiple actual length exams so you can take as it is actual exams.
customer_reviews.author: J Park

customer_reviews.title: It's a SAT practice book
customer_reviews.text: It is a practice book and it is very thick
customer_reviews.author: ivy

customer_reviews.title: Too much information
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic review guide but almost too much information - some not really needed to take and ace the SAT's. A smaller condensed version would probably be equal to the prep work involved. This is thicker than the old fashioned phone books.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Prep guide
customer_reviews.text: SAT prep, if you are taking the test, you need to practice
customer_reviews.author: Tiny

customer_reviews.title: Not actually 8 full length practice tests
customer_reviews.text: There are only 4 full length practice tests in the book, unless I'm missing something.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Van Nostrand

customer_reviews.title: No test forms.
customer_reviews.text: They forgot to include the test forms for the practice tests. Their ACT book includes the test forms.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Cappelloni

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Helping me study and it’s doing a great job of helping me review!
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Book for SAT
customer_reviews.text: I brought this book for my daughter,I think this is good study guide for the SAT, this seems to be a good book to use. There are practice tests and it provides great information to help one prepare for the SAT. I try so many expensive class for my daughter it only help very little , I have let her try to study this thick book her self . Hope that can help her .
customer_reviews.author: hong

customer_reviews.title: Well....
customer_reviews.text: I just started using this book and I don’t think it’s the best honestly. If you’re like me and you want a high score on the SAT, I suggest you spend $30 elsewhere. Consider College Panda, Erica Meltzer, and the SAT Black book. Those books I’ve heard are quite good, even though the might be expensive. The Princeton Review book is just OK and nothing else. Hopefully this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Angela S

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: Super awesome a lot of stuff in the book help my son boost him sat score more than the teacher thought him
customer_reviews.author: ming

product_meta.title: Princeton Review SAT Premium Prep, 2021: 8 Practice Tests + Review & Techniques + Online Tools (College Test Preparation)
